content: That’s a superb analysis. The fact that we don’t know how exposed our stories are has disturbed me for a while, because it severely limits our ability to conduct a statistical analysis. Just knowing how many people click on the story and how many read all the way through it isn’t enough. I’ve also noticed that if I indulge in a particular author or subject, then the algorithm shifts for me for a few days. It looks like a spiderweb to me. I’ve had not just conversations of an author or recommendations of an author, but stories from authors that said author reads come into my timeline before. But there seems to have been a slight revamp of the algorithm a month ago or so.
